Authors: Irwansyah E., Kanigoro B., Budiman P., Bekti R.D.
Title: Earthquake Ground Motion Attenuation Modeling Using Levenberg-Marquardt and Brute-Force Method
Source title: Advances in Intelligent Systems and Computing
Affiliations: School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Department of Statistic, Institut Sains and Teknologi AKPRIND, Yogyakarta, 55222, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Irwansyah, E., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Kanigoro, B., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Budiman, P., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Bekti, R.D., Department of Statistic, Institut Sains and Teknologi AKPRIND, Yogyakarta, 55222, Indonesia
Abstract: In this paper, we discuss the results of research on the optimization modeling of ground motion attenuation in the subduction zone of the model Youngs et al. [1] using two methods: the Levenberg-Marquard and Bruce-Force method. This modeling is particularly important in the case of seismicity. Given that it takes a good model for predicting the strength of earthquakes in order to reduce the risk of the impact of natural disasters. Two major contributions of this study are ground motion attenuation model specific to the subduction zone that has been optimized with the Levenberg-Marquard method and Bruce-Force uses a model Youngs et al. [1] and a proof that the Levenberg-Marquard method for optimization model is better than Bruce-Force method. The Levenberg-Marquardt method has been proven to provide more accurate results on the modeling of ground motion attenuation which is indicated by a very small deviation between the values of PGA predictable results with the PGA actual values. © 2018, Springer International Publishing AG.
Index Keywords: Computational methods; Disasters; Geophysics; Optimization; Earthquake ground motions; Force method; Ground-motion attenuations; Levenberg-Marquardt; Levenberg-Marquardt method; Natural disasters; Optimization modeling; Subduction zones; Earthquakes

Authors: Irwansyah E., Lukmanto R.B., Bekti R.D., Budiman P.
Title: Computer-based ground motion attenuation modeling using Levenberg-Marquardt method
Source title: Advances in Intelligent Systems and Computing
Affiliations: School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. KH. Syahdan No. 9, Kemanggisan, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Department of Statistics, Institut Sains and Teknologi AKPRIND, Jl. Kalisahak No. 28 Kompleks Balapan Tromol Pos 45, Yogyakarta, 55222, Indonesia; Department of Statistics, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. KH. Syahdan No. 9, Kemanggisan, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Irwansyah, E., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. KH. Syahdan No. 9, Kemanggisan, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Lukmanto, R.B., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. KH. Syahdan No. 9, Kemanggisan, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Bekti, R.D., Department of Statistics, Institut Sains and Teknologi AKPRIND, Jl. Kalisahak No. 28 Kompleks Balapan Tromol Pos 45, Yogyakarta, 55222, Indonesia; Budiman, P., Department of Statistics, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. KH. Syahdan No. 9, Kemanggisan, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: In this paper, we present the results of research on the optimization modeling of ground motion attenuation of the two establish models by Youngs et al. [25] and the model of Lin and Lee [13] using the Levenberg-Marquardt method. This modeling is particularly important in the case of ground motion given that it takes a good model for predicting the strength of earthquakes in order to reduce the risk of the impact of the natural disaster. There are two main contributions of this research is the optimization of ground motion attenuation models with Levenberg-Marquardt method on two models that have been extensively used and the development of computer applications to help accelerate modeling, especially on large data with an area of extensive research. Levenberg-Marquardt method proved to give a good contribution to the modeling of ground motion attenuation that is indicated by the very small deviations between the predicted values with the actual value. © Springer International Publishing Switzerland 2016.
Index Keywords: Computer control systems; Disasters; Geophysics; Intelligent systems; Optimization; Ground motions; Ground-motion attenuations; Large data; Levenberg-Marquardt; Levenberg-Marquardt method; Natural disasters; Optimization modeling; Earthquakes
